title: Pirsig's Dynamic Quality, Markov Blankets, Solms' Book, The Hidden Spring and Glen's Theory of Life
description:
Sevilla of A Quality Existence visits with Karen of The Meaning Code.
We discuss the possible intersections of the ideas of Robert Pirsig (Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance), Mark Solms (The Hidden Spring - A Journey to the Source of Consciousness) and Glen from Episodes 1 through 6 of the Meaning Code's series on What is Life?
Computation is more fundamental than information.
Relationships are more fundamental than things. 
Mechanisms are more fundamental than output.
Conditions are more fundamental than results.

There is something to be perceived, then the perceiver perceives, decides and acts. The relationship of these events is termed "dynamic quality" by Pirsig. Static quality (static patterns) something that is already defined, anything that can be found in a dictionary.

More thoughts on the rat example in the discussion (the difference between the rats that "love the lever" and the rats that go right to where the food will be).

Faith is the substance of things hoped for. We are meant to experience "substance", not "substitutes". The food is the hoped for thing. It becomes "substance" when it is provided by the Promiser, when the 
Promise is fulfilled, you could say, when the potential (the frame, the mesh, the matrix of possibility) is interpenetrated with the substance. The Promiser is the only one who knows when the food will actually arrive, but the addictable rats fall in love with the promise which is a poor substitute for the Promiser. The non-addictable rats trust that the Promiser will
deliver on the promise and provide the food. There is a verse in scripture, "I am crucified with Christ, nevertheless I live. It's not I, but Christ, who lives in me. And the life that I now live, I live by the faith of the Son of God who loved me and died for me." It is by His faith that we are able to receive the 
substance of the thing hoped for. The poor addictable rats are sitting over there worshipping the golden calf while the rest of the Israelites are enjoying the manna from heaven (symbolically speakinig, of course, as these moments were not contemporaneous:-) Also, "Every promise of God is 'Yes!' in Jesus Christ." The Promiser is greater than the promise.

Conversations being discussed here include:
Mark Solms on Consciousness:  https://youtu.be/9DoK7JdvGhU
Glen's Episode 6 on Emergence: https://youtu.be/2m8kw8Q5Xf8
  (See also Episodes 1 through 5 on The Meaning Code channel)
Sevilla's Channel, A Quality Existence:  https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC6vg0HkKKlgsWk-3HfV-vnw
